title: @Meddler are you guys planning on reworking Orianna? She's had the same kit for years.
body: Orianna feels kinda boring since she's been my main for a while now and she hasn't been changed at all. I want her to be buffed actually because she has pretty unreliable damage in lane and is only good in teamfights. Please get back to me on this.

replies.body:
No plans for a rework, no, we think Orianna's got a good kit. 

Considering some slight buffs in 6.17 though, she's been underperforming for a while. Small W haste % increase and a small R CD reduction the current changes being tested.
What are your thoughts about making her R 100/100/100 mana instead of 100/125/150, keeping her in line with a lot of other champions?
Seems like a reasonable change, I'll check with the team, see if they're already considered it or not.
Just revert the -6AD nerf you made 2 seasons ago
this, oris mana is actually super good with even just tear.. 40% cdr spamming like crazy I had no issue lol
Have you thought about making her ult still go off if she dies while casting it? Maybe not if she just pressed it, but it it's like 50% though the animation or something
honestly, often when I die on Ori, I am glad the ult didn't go through cause it was a panic ult :P

There has to be more thought that goes into buffs than "Champion x is underperforming". There are a lot of champions that are underperforming. Poppy is hurting very badly from her pile of nerfs, Tahm Kench is underperforming as well, but no buffs are slated for them. What other factors determine buffs?

Things like:

* Performance at a range of skill levels. Performance doesn't just mean win rate, but instead includes things like an assessment of power when played in an appropriate team comp, against appropriate enemies, by experience on the champion etc.
* How healthy the champion is for the game. That assessment involves whether they have a positive or negative effect on things like other champion diversity, whether their kit has appropriate counterplay, whether they lead to passive or active games etc.
* How long a champion's been underperforming. All else being equal champions that have been weak for a longer time are more of a priority.
Aatrox is exactly what you mentioned up there. He has been in a bad spot for a really long time at all ratings. Even high elo Aatrox mains have trouble performing well with him.

Kit isn't hard to balance it. It's quite easy, even I could do it.

No, you couldn't. If you shorten CD on his passive, he promotes passive gameplay on both sides. Damage increase on Q or E and he just builds full tank with good base damage. CDR on Q and E and he becomes an assassin. Higher ratios on Q and E and he becomes a scaling jungler, similar to Yi, loses identity. If you increase his damage on W or increase the healing on it, he just builds full tank and is unkillable. If you reduce it to 2 hits, he just becomes broken as an AA champion in general. If you decrease his W cost for damage, he becomes an early game monster. If you decrease CD on ult, promotes passive play because you can't ever 1v1 him. If you increase the damage or scaling, suddenly we have a full tank Aatrox or a gimmicky hybrid Aatrox. You can't really increase the range, but if you increase the duration, it only helps him if he's fed enough. In short, there is no real place in the game for Aatrox. The class of auto attackers are meant for split pushing and 1v1ing, yet his kit is built around sustaining damage while dealing some in a teamfight. He can't be balanced because his actual role and intended role are different, and not fixable without a rework. He's so similar to Tryndamere, but Trynda's immortality comes at a lower cost, cooldown, and allows him to kill.

Really? You want me to tell you? Fine.

Passive: Revive removed. Attack speed changed from 30-50% to 40%.

Q: cannot be interrupted (think Tristana jump, but he's knockup immune)

W: every third strike gains 30/35/40/45/50% armor pen to that attack. W bloodprice damage to tripled HP cost from quadruple HP cost. (Damage is about the same, but he now damages tanks like a normal person.) W bloodthirst healing normal raised, healing under half health lowered to 30/35/40/45/50% from doubled.

E: slows more, covers entire AoE instead the edge (QoL for waveclear)

R: cast time reduced, ranged slightly increased

Base stats: 30 base HP, base armor and MR raised by 3.

Call it a mini rework if you want to, but it's really simple. Remove the useless revive, give him real base stats. Make his W useful above half HP, and not HP under half. Give him a way to kill tanks, like a normal bruiser.
